title: Episode #1.1
description: Frank sings "When You're Smiling" and "Ol' Man River." In a pantomime sketch, Ben appears as Charlie Chaplin, with Frank as The Kid. J. Carrol Naish was the star of the popular "Life With Luigi" on radio, and plays the title character here in a sketch that provides viewers with a preview of what the show might look like in the new medium.

title: Episode #1.5
description: Highlights include Frank Sinatra and Nancy Walker performing "Let's Go Up to My Place" from 'On the Town' and a sketch featuring Frank playing the star of private detective radio series with Ben Blue as his inept sound effects man.

title: Episode #1.18
description: Jackie Gleason convinces Frank to buy a "hunting lodge" he recently inherited sight unseen. Frank decides to spend the next weekend visiting his newly purchased property and invites Jackie, June Hutton and the Heathertones to join him with disastrous results.

title: Episode #1.31
description: Frank sings "Hello Young Lovers", "When Your Smiling" "If" and several duets with guests. Fine musical numbers and uneven comedy routines.

title: Episode #2.5
description: Rather than a series of songs and sketches, this program consists entirely of a "book" musical with two singing detectives hot on the trail of $100,000 of stolen loot.

title: Episode #2.13
description: It's New Year's Eve, and Frank Sinatra is throwing his big annual New Year's Eve party, with plenty of guests and entertainment. He hires three servants to take care of the guests and help with running the party, but the three turn out to be complete incompetents who cause chaos and havoc.
